title: [Large-scale] Generative AI-Enabled Teacher Competency Enhancement Workshop: Social Studies-Integrated Lesson Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, foundational understanding of educational contexts, and introductory knowledge of social studies core concepts (citizenship, cultural diversity, historical awareness, geospatial analysis, etc.)
context.additional_context: Designed for pre-service vocational teachers, smartphone-based practice-oriented curriculum. Highlights AI applications in social studies contexts (historical document analysis, geographic data visualization, economic statistical modeling). Focuses on cultivating competencies to design citizen-participatory projects for solving local community issues.

learning_goals: Explain the principles and ethical considerations of applying generative AI in education within a social studies context (e.g., citizenship, cultural diversity, historical context).

Implement a three-stage personalized instructional design process (needs analysis → activity design → assessment planning) using AI tools and apply it to social studies inquiry activities (e.g., historical analysis, geographic data visualization).

Through four weeks of collaborative project-based learning, learners will develop one social studies lesson design plan utilizing AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, data visualization tools) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric evaluating three civic competencies: digital literacy, critical thinking, and collaboration skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
